body:
There are some general code bits for writing posix/cshell content that currently reside in the [openfoam-com][openfoam] package [Line 100][L100] - [Line 205][L205].

I don't see anything else similar being used within spack, but nonetheless wondered if it might make sense to relocate these generic bits into some place like the environment.py ? It would certainly make the openfoam-com package look smaller, and might even be useful to someone else.

Thoughts @alalazo or @tgamblin ?

Cheers,
/mark

[openfoam]: https://github.com/spack/spack/blob/develop/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/openfoam-com/package.py
[L100]: https://github.com/spack/spack/blob/develop/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/openfoam-com/package.py#L101
[L205]: https://github.com/spack/spack/blob/develop/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/openfoam-com/package.py#L205
title: refactor env handling from openfoam-com to environment.py
